message:
We have seen an increase in successful prosecutions when education is provided to law enforcement, prosecutors, and judges. A difference can be made. 
 “States need to add resources into support trafficking victims, educate the public and train law enforcement if the numbers of prosecutions and convictions are to improve, officials and experts say.”

data.description: Laws cracking down on human trafficking are on the books in all 50 states, but convictions are notoriously elusive
data.title: State prosecutors struggle with human trafficking cases
